means: 图瓦卢（西太平洋岛国）（旧称埃利斯群岛）

sentence.Network_en: Seawater step by step groundfeed Tuvalu person to live.
sentence.Network_cn: 海水步步进逼,正在侵食图瓦卢人的生存之地.

sentence.Network_en: The tiny Pacific islands of Tuvalu may already experiencing the effects of rising sea levels.
sentence.Network_cn: 属于太平洋群岛的图瓦卢,可能正受着水位上升的影响.

sentence.Network_en: But Tuvalu is not the first place to face sinking into the sea.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是第一个面临被海水淹没威胁的地方并非图瓦卢.

means.word_mean: 1. a small island republic on the Tuvalu islands; formerly part of the British colony of Gilbert and Ellice Islands until it withdrew in 1975 and became independent of the United Kingdom in 1978
2. a group of coral islands in Micronesia southwest of Hawaii
